title: How Can Online HRM and Payroll Software Benefit Modern Businesses?
content:
Online HRM and payroll software has become an essential tool for modern businesses to manage their workforce efficiently. These systems automate routine HR tasks like attendance tracking, leave management, payroll processing, and employee data management. By doing so, they save time, reduce errors, and allow HR teams to focus on strategic activities that drive growth.

One major benefit is automation of payroll. The software calculates salaries, deductions, taxes, and bonuses automatically, ensuring accuracy and timely payment. This reduces the risk of errors and ensures compliance with labor laws and tax regulations. Employees can also access their payslips online, which improves transparency and satisfaction.

Another advantage is streamlined employee management. Businesses can store all employee information in a centralized system, making it easy to update records, track performance, and monitor attendance. Many systems include self-service portals where employees can update personal details, apply for leave, and view attendance, which reduces administrative workload.

Leave and attendance management is also simplified. Employees can mark attendance through web or mobile apps, and leave requests are processed automatically. Advanced features like geolocation or face recognition improve accuracy, especially for remote or field teams.
creator: ezyhrmsoftware

title: browser.tabs.groups.smart.enabled, but not other config settings, resets to "true" every time I restart firefox.
content:
The AI tab thing is a problem for me for multiple reasons. I found various articles about how to turn it off. They pointed to the following setting: In about:config set the setting "browser.tabs.groups.smart.enabled" to false, and then restart Firefox.

However, when I do that, and then immediately go back to about:Config to check the setting, it has changed itself back to "true".

Other settings accept and keep permanent changes. This means that I'm not forgetting to save the change or anything. Just this one setting (which turns off something causing me problems) refuses to actually stay set.

I see the answer to this question https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1509077 and tried looking there. There is a completed study called "Smart Tab Groups Rollout", but since it is in the "Completed Studies" group, I cannot remove it.
creator: boydstnp

title: Unable to delete history
content:
I use ccleaner to run regular cleans on my computer. Noticed after running it today that my history wasn't deleted. I tried manual delete to see if it was a ccleaner but and still no deletion. I turned of history sync in my profile, also checked that permanent incognito mode is not turned on.

Last resort I uninstalled and re-installed (twice, once using REVO) yet all of my history is still there.

Any thoughts?

My browser, OS and drivers are fully updated.
